key_points: Tiger Woods is recovering from a car accident in Los Angeles.
Golfers wore Woods' signature Sunday-red shirt and black pants in various tournaments as a show of support.
Rory McIlroy, Jason Day, Justin Thomas, Tony Finau, and others participated in the gesture.
Some players like Billy Horschel showed their support through accessories like hats with "TW" etched on them.
Golf balls stamped with "TIGER" were used by Matt Kuchar, Jason Day, and Bryson DeChambeau.
Rory McIlroy mentioned the gesture was to let Woods know they are thinking of him and rooting for him.
Tony Finau stressed the importance of showing support to Woods, acknowledging his influence on their Sundays.
Sebastian Munoz paid tribute to Woods as his idol and a significant influence on his decision to play golf.
Jason Day aimed to pay respects and wished Woods a quick recovery.
Justin Thomas saw the gesture as an opportunity to show support on a significant day for Woods.
